maml:description.maml:para: {{ Fill in the Synopsis }}
{{ Fill in the Description }}
If specified only active records (statecode=0 or isactive=true) will be output
DataverseConnection instance obtained from Get-DataverseConnnection cmdlet, or string specifying Dataverse organization URL (e.g. http://server.com/MyOrg/)
Extra criteria to apply to query
If specified the exclude filters will be logically combined using OR instead of the default of AND

List of hashsets of fields names,values to filter records by using an NOTEQUALS condition (or ISNOTNULL if null value). If more than one hashset is provided then they are logically combined using an AND condition by default. e.g. @{firstname="bob", age=25}, @{firstname="sue"} will find records where (firstname<>bob AND age<>25) OR (firstname<>sue)
List of record ids to exclude

List of hashsets of fields names,values to filter records by using an EQUALS condition (or ISNULL if null value). If more than one hashset is provided then they are logically combined using an OR condition. e.g. @{firstname="bob", age=25}, @{firstname="sue"} will find records where (firstname=bob AND age=25) OR (firstname=sue)
List of primary keys (IDs) of records to retrieve.
Link entities to apply to query
Outputs Names for lookup values. The default behaviour is to output the ID.
List of names (primary attribute value) of records to retrieve.
List of fields to order records by. Suffix field name with - to sort descending. e.g "age-", "lastname" will sort by age descending then lastname ascending
Number of records to request per page. Default is 1000.
If set writes total record count matching query to output output instead of results
Number of records to limit result to. Default is all results.
If set writes total record count matching query to verbose output
List of columns to return in records (default is all). Each column name may be suffixed with :Raw or :Display to override the value type which will be output from the default
List of columns to exclude from records (default is none). Ignored if Columns parameter is used.s
Excludes system columns from output. Default is all columns except system columns. Ignored if Columns parameter is used.
Logical name of entity for which to retrieve records
DataverseConnection instance obtained from Get-DataverseConnnection cmdlet, or string specifying Dataverse organization URL (e.g. http://server.com/MyOrg/)
Outputs Names for lookup values. The default behaviour is to output the ID.
Number of records to request per page. Default is 1000.
If set writes total record count matching query to output output instead of results
Number of records to limit result to. Default is all results.
If set writes total record count matching query to verbose output
FetchXml to use
If specified only active records (statecode=0 or isactive=true) will be output
DataverseConnection instance obtained from Get-DataverseConnnection cmdlet, or string specifying Dataverse organization URL (e.g. http://server.com/MyOrg/)
Extra criteria to apply to query
If specified the exclude filters will be logically combined using OR instead of the default of AND

List of hashsets of fields names,values to filter records by using an NOTEQUALS condition (or ISNOTNULL if null value). If more than one hashset is provided then they are logically combined using an AND condition by default. e.g. @{firstname="bob", age=25}, @{firstname="sue"} will find records where (firstname<>bob AND age<>25) OR (firstname<>sue)
List of record ids to exclude

List of hashsets of fields names,values to filter records by using an EQUALS condition (or ISNULL if null value). If more than one hashset is provided then they are logically combined using an OR condition. e.g. @{firstname="bob", age=25}, @{firstname="sue"} will find records where (firstname=bob AND age=25) OR (firstname=sue)
List of primary keys (IDs) of records to retrieve.
Link entities to apply to query
Outputs Names for lookup values. The default behaviour is to output the ID.
List of names (primary attribute value) of records to retrieve.
List of fields to order records by. Suffix field name with - to sort descending. e.g "age-", "lastname" will sort by age descending then lastname ascending
Number of records to request per page. Default is 1000.
If set writes total record count matching query to output output instead of results
Number of records to limit result to. Default is all results.
If set writes total record count matching query to verbose output
List of columns to return in records (default is all). Each column name may be suffixed with :Raw or :Display to override the value type which will be output from the default
List of columns to exclude from records (default is none). Ignored if Columns parameter is used.s
FetchXml to use
Excludes system columns from output. Default is all columns except system columns. Ignored if Columns parameter is used.
Logical name of entity for which to retrieve records

maml:description.maml:para: Creates or updates Dataverse records.
{{ Fill in the Description }}
{{ Fill BatchSize Description }}
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
DataverseConnection instance obtained from Get-DataverseConnnection cmdlet, or string specifying Dataverse organization URL (e.g. http://server.com/MyOrg/)

If specified, no check for existing record is made and records will always be attempted to be created. Use this option when it's known that no existing matching records will exist to improve performance. See the -noupdate option for an alternative.
ID of record to be created or updated.
List of properties on the input object which are ignored and not attemted to be mapped to the record. Default is none.

Object containing values to be used. Property names must match the logical names of Dataverse fields in the specified entity and the property values are used to set the values of the Dataverse record being created/updated. The properties may include ownerid, statecode and statuscode which will assign and change the record state/status.

List of list of field names that identify an existing record to update based on the values of those fields in the InputObject. These are used if a record with and Id matching the value of the Id cannot be found. The first list that returns a match is used. e.g. ("firstname", "lastname"), "fullname" will try to find an existing record based on the firstname AND listname from the InputObject and if not found it will try by fullname. Not supported with -Upsert
If specified then no records will be created even if no existing records matching the ID and or MatchOn fields is found.
If specified existing records matching the ID and or MatchOn fields will not be updated.
If specified, the InputObject is written to the pipeline with an Id property set indicating the primary key of the affected record (even if nothing was updated).
If specified, upsert request will be used to create/update existing records as appropriate. -MatchOn is not supported with this option
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

If specified, the creation/updates will be done on behalf of the user with the specified ID. For best performance, sort the records using this value since a new batch request is needed each time this value changes.
Hashset of lookup column name in the target entity to column name in the referred to entity with which to find the records.
List of column names which will not be included when updating existing records.
Logical name of entity
If specified an update containing all supplied columns will be issued without retrieving the existing record for comparison (default is to remove unchanged columns). Id must be provided
{{ Fill BatchSize Description }}
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
DataverseConnection instance obtained from Get-DataverseConnnection cmdlet, or string specifying Dataverse organization URL (e.g. http://server.com/MyOrg/)

If specified, no check for existing record is made and records will always be attempted to be created. Use this option when it's known that no existing matching records will exist to improve performance. See the -noupdate option for an alternative.
ID of record to be created or updated.
List of properties on the input object which are ignored and not attemted to be mapped to the record. Default is none.

Object containing values to be used. Property names must match the logical names of Dataverse fields in the specified entity and the property values are used to set the values of the Dataverse record being created/updated. The properties may include ownerid, statecode and statuscode which will assign and change the record state/status.

List of list of field names that identify an existing record to update based on the values of those fields in the InputObject. These are used if a record with and Id matching the value of the Id cannot be found. The first list that returns a match is used. e.g. ("firstname", "lastname"), "fullname" will try to find an existing record based on the firstname AND listname from the InputObject and if not found it will try by fullname. Not supported with -Upsert
If specified then no records will be created even if no existing records matching the ID and or MatchOn fields is found.
If specified existing records matching the ID and or MatchOn fields will not be updated.
If specified, the InputObject is written to the pipeline with an Id property set indicating the primary key of the affected record (even if nothing was updated).
If specified, upsert request will be used to create/update existing records as appropriate. -MatchOn is not supported with this option
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.

If specified, the creation/updates will be done on behalf of the user with the specified ID. For best performance, sort the records using this value since a new batch request is needed each time this value changes.
Hashset of lookup column name in the target entity to column name in the referred to entity with which to find the records.
List of column names which will not be included when updating existing records.
Logical name of entity
If specified an update containing all supplied columns will be issued without retrieving the existing record for comparison (default is to remove unchanged columns). Id must be provided
